title: Support for downloading projects [request]
body: It might sound a bit weird the request but as soon as you have some projects working on, sometimes you want to be sure that in some moment you'll be able to download all the website. I would like to have a way to download the project from surge with a single client command.

title: is domain limited?
body: i uploaded more than one sites seems new domain not working properly.

title: Provide way to drop ownership of subdomain
body:
I can view my subdomains with `surge list`

If I see a subdomain I no longer wish to maintain ownership of, there is no way to drop it via the CLI. 

Something like `surge drop bad-speellingg.surge.sh` should drop ownership of `bad-speellingg.surge.sh` such that `surge list` no longer displays it.

title: Routing with pushState not working
body:
Hi, I'm trying to deploy a single page app built with Backbone.js. I'm using Backbone router with pushState for URL routing and renaming index.html to 200.html so it handles all request.

However, I couldn't get the URL `example.surge.sh/myroute` to work as intended, it always return the 404 page. I hope that's enough details but feel free to ask me for more details.

Is there something I'm doing wrong here?

title: The route /list doesn’t work with a 200.html file
body:
**Expected**

With a `200.html` file in the root…
- http://example-200.surge.sh/asdf/ → `200.html` should work
- http://example-200.surge.sh/asdf → `200.html` should work
- http://example-200.surge.sh/list/ → `200.html` should work
- http://example-200.surge.sh/list → `200.html` should work

**Actual**
- http://example-200.surge.sh/asdf/ → `200.html` works
- http://example-200.surge.sh/asdf → `200.html` works
- http://example-200.surge.sh/list/ → `200.html` works
- http://example-200.surge.sh/list → `200.html` shows the default 404 page

`/list` is working as a reserved word. Reported by @rgdelato in Slack.

title: Could have an way to set custom headers, specifically HSTS
body:
Documenting this to preserve some of my notes. We’ve had some feature requests for custom headers. While we do already set proper [caching headers, etc.](https://surge.sh/help/using-lucid-caching-automatically) and are very happy with our default caching stategy, there are cases where people do want to set very specific options beyond our base settings.

Additionally, this is one of the only a very small number of things not covered when [migrating from Divshot](https://surge.sh/help/migrating-from-divshot).
- [Thread on Twitter about HSTS header](https://twitter.com/kennethormandy/status/659430049402085378)
- Questions about caching headers are now usually resolved with [this article](https://surge.sh/help/using-lucid-caching-automatically), but there still have been requests for further options

We have talked about an `HSTS` file, but it might also be valuable to take care of this in a way that handles more than one header, so you don’t end up with _too_ many all-caps files in the root.

title: Adds basic tests for actions with Minimist, Yargs, Commander
body:
Looking for feedback on this, these are some basic tests to make sure the `surge.login()` action works with Minimist, Yargs, and Commander. Not sure whether it’s better to test all of those specifically, since we try to have them work well together, or if we should just be test the actions exist?

![2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1581276/11283282/cc04a088-8eb8-11e5-9a60-31dee7e8d3cb.gif)

To try this out, run:

``` sh
npm test -- test/actions.js
```

Only done for login so far. The tests could be more or less involved depending on what you think.

title: Fixes parser for Yargs
Should support Commander’s command + desc syntax?
body:
Right now, if you add a Commander command with a description included…

``` js
var program = require('commander')
var surge = require('surge')()
var hooks = {}

program
  .command('teardown [domain]', 'Remove a live project.')
  .action(surge.teardown(hooks))
```

…you get an error like this, repeated multiple times:

``` sh
surge: `--commands` is not a surge command.
```

Not entirely sure if this is a problem with how we’re parsing things from Commander, or I could be misunderstanding how this is supposed to work with Commander, but I thought I would document it for now.

title: Shouldn’t generate in-use random domain name
body:
https://twitter.com/sebduggan/status/657187849385693184

I believe we relied on statistics for this one, to ensure domain duplication didn’t happen. This may be fairly unlikely to happen again, we may need to introduce another element (ex. `adjective-noun-##.surge.sh) or maybe we need to add another check into the random domain name generation.

title: .well-known/keybase.txt not deployed
body: I'm deploying https://github.com/astrolet/astrolet.co with surge and the `www/.well-known/keybase.txt` is not being served.  Guessing that you filter .hidden directories?

title: Minor correction in the documentation
body:
The [ignoring files and directories](https://surge.sh/help/ignoring-files-and-directories) page says that by default, `node_modules` is excluded, and that you can add `!node_modules/` to `.surgeignore` to override that exclusion.

For me, that override didn't work until I removed the trailing slash. Is that a mistake in the documentation, or a weird quirk of my surge site?

Thank you!

title: Routing with Backbone on subdirectory
body:
Hi,

I'm trying to set up push state routing with Backbone which means I want request to be handled by my front end logic. I saw that I need to setup a 200.html page and also saw that I can just rename index.html to 200.html.

However that doesn't seem to work for me. It might be because of my directory structure. Currently it's like this:

> index.html
> subdir/index.html
> subdir/app.js

So the link `something-interesting.surge.sh` will visit `index.html` which is a static page.

The link `something-interesting.surge.sh/subdir` will visit `subdir/index.html` which contains app.js with Backbone routing. The effect I'm looking for is visiting `something-interesting.surge.sh/subdir/action` will trigger routing with Backbone instead of a 404 page because it's looking for the subdirectory.

simply changing `subdir/index.html` to `subdir/200.html` does not work and just give a 404 even when visiting `something-interesting.surge.sh/subdir`. Can someone advise on what I should do?

Hope it's clear enough. Thanks in advance. : )

title: Unable to login; continuous password reset
body:
Windows 7
Running from Node.js command prompt

I'm able to get to the password question and go through 3 tries with a correct password then it resends the reset. Website accepts the password and the process repeats.

title: Should be clear the project is online when there’s no index.html file included
body: I've tried the suggestion of surging a directory of images (as well as another of gifs), but the generated site always results in not found, e.g. http://gifdog.surge.sh

title: Adding groups of collaborators
body:
Hey! Thanks for Surge, it's awesome.

It would be helpful if there was a way to add or remove groups of people as collaborators. Examples might be whitelisting everyone with a particular email domain, or everyone who's part of a certain GitHub org.

title: Certain images not deployed
body:
Sorry I've got a strange issue

Im running Surge v0.11.1 and Im getting a couple of '404 image not found' 

The strange part is that images from exactly the same directory are being loaded but **some** of them are not. Is there a data limit on how many images I can load? Are the images corrupted (re-running surge and the same images are not found)?

Note: The images are display correctly on my local machine. 
Note 2: I just noticed some image names get capitalised on deployment.

title: Registration not possible on Windows 8.1 x64
body: I tried to deploy a simple project with just index.html in it but the registration procedure is not creating a proper logon for me. I entered my email and a password but surge keeps asking me to enter a password. I tried different combinations (with capital letters, special chars etc.). I also tried to use surge via Cygwin / Bash but still get the same "error".

title: Support for already gzip’d files?
body:
I just tried deploying my Octopress (based on Jekyll) static site, and it worked perfectly. This is a great product so far. One thing that would be great to add is support for compressed files. Currently, my site is hosted on S3, and I upload gzipped HTML and CSS, then set the `Content-Encoding` on S3 to `gzip`.

Do you have any plans to support gzip content?

title: How do you use the HTML5 mode 200.html pages feature?
body: Hi, I'd like to redirect all requests to my index.html - how do you do it?

title: Trouble adding user
body:
Can't seem to add a third user:

```
js.la[master]% surge -a jacob@js.la

              email: david@guttman.io
       project path: (js.la) ./dist
               size: 182 files, 11.5 MB
             upload: [====================] 100%, eta: 0.0s
   propagate on CDN: [====================] 100%
              users: mike@js.la, david@guttman.io
         IP address: 192.201.204.118

    Success! Project is published and running at js.la
```

Looked inside and saw that the header "add" is there, but the final user payload comes back without the new user.

title: Ignoring files
body: I would like to have a way to ignore certain files when uploading a directory. For example OS X `.DS_store` files or files generated by my IDE.

title: Can't surge at all - error with publishing
body:
Whenever I do a surge test, I get: Aborted - you must be granted access to publish to quiet-creature.surge.sh

I haven't tried to set the domain at all - I'm taking the defaults.
